document.docAuthor: Viraktamath, C. A. & Webb, M. D.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Signoretia (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Signoretiinae) of the Oriental region with description of nine new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Signoretia (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Signoretiinae) of the Oriental region with description of nine new species

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Signoretia Stål
from the Oriental region

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Orange yellow and red ( Figs 29–30 ) or chocolate brown species ( Figs 12–13 , 43–45 )................................ 2
- Creamy white or pale green species with or without black or dark brown markings ( Figs 1 –11,14–28, 31–42, 46–48)....... 4

2. Orange yellow species with black spots on head and thorax, basal 0.75 of forewing red ( Figs 29–30 ) ( Thailand )....................................................................................................
S. rubra
sp. nov.

3. Head and pronotum with dorsal median longitudinal pale stripe ( Fig. 12 ); clypellus in profile angularly raised ( Fig. 68 , arrowed) (Sri Lanka).......................................................................
S. greeni Distant

materialsCitation.keyLead:
- Head and pronotum without dorsal median longitudinal pale stripe ( Fig. 43 ); clypellus in profile not angularly raised ( Fig. 45 ) ( Indonesia : Sumatra )..................................................................
S. sumatrana Schmidt

paragraph.keyLead: 5. Crown narrowed beyond ocelli and strongly produced in front ( Figs 23 , 33, 41 )....................................6
- Crown broadly rounded and weakly produced in front ( Figs 1 , 14,16)............................................ 8
6. Male pygofer ventral process long, extending beyond dorsal margin (Figs 133,176)................................. 7

materialsCitation.keyLead:
- Male pygofer ventral process short, not reaching dorsal margin (see Fig. 2 , Li, 1995 ) ( China : Fujian . Taiwan) ... ..
S. yangi Li

paragraph.keyLead:
7. Atrial process of aedeagal shaft bifid ( Figs 180, 181 ) ( India : Darjeeling)............................
S. sinuata
sp. nov.

materialsCitation.keyLead:
- Atrial process of aedeagal shaft simple, not bifid ( Figs 136 –137 ) ( India : Arunachal Pradesh , Myanmar , Mishmi Hills)........................................................................................
S. mishmiensis
sp. nov.

paragraph.keyLead: 8. Male pygofer ventral process length beyond pygofer longer than height of posterior pygofer lobe in lateral view ( Figs 98 , 121 ).................................................................................................... 9

- Male pygofer ventral process length beyond pygofer shorter than height of posterior pygofer lobe in lateral view ( Figs 113 , 162 ) or not reaching pygofer dorsal margin ( Fig. 169 )........................................................ 10

materialsCitation.keyLead:
9. Aedeagal shaft about 0.70 as long as atrium, latter about twice as wide as shaft in posterior view ( Fig. 104 ) ( India : Arunachal Pradesh . Myanmar )......................................................................
S. aureola Distant

- Aedeagal shaft about 0.60 as long as atrium, latter about four times as wide as shaft in posterior view ( Fig. 129 ) ( India : Arunachal Pradesh . Myanmar ).............................................................
S. maculata Baker

paragraph.keyLead: 10. Pygofer ventral process exceeding dorsoposterior margin ( Figs 113 , 162 ).........................................11

- Pygofer ventral process short, internal, not reaching dorsoposterior margin ( Fig. 169 ) (Vietnam: Fyan)...
S. similaris
sp. nov.
11. Ventral process arms of aedeagus in dorsal view acutely pointed ( Figs 116 , 187 )................................... 12

12. Ventral process arms of aedeagus in ventral view divergent from base, dorsal margin setose ( Fig. 187 ) ( India : Andaman Islands).............................................................................. ..
S. takiyae
sp. nov.

materialsCitation.keyLead:
- Ventral process arms of aedeagus in ventral view close together and divergent only distally, without setae ( Fig. 116 ) ( India : Mizoram )...............................................................................
S. lunglei
sp. nov.

13. Ventral process arms of aedeagus in lateral view more or less parallel sided, apically slightly broadened ( Fig. 166 ) ( India : Western Ghats)..................................................................... ..
S. sahyadrica
sp. nov.

- Ventral process arms of aedeagus in lateral view gradually narrowed towards apex and pointed (
Takiya et al . 2013
: Fig. 39 ) ( Malaysia : Malacca, Penang . Philippines, Singapore )............................................ ..
S. malaya (Stål)

- Pronotum as wide as long ( Fig. 7 a, Baker, 1923 ) ( Philippines : Benguet , Luzon)....................
S. benguetensis Baker

paragraph.keyLead: - Median pronotal carina not complete, either confined to pronotal foveae or extend only slightly beyond ( Fig. 6, 8–10 , 25 )....................................................................................................... 17

16. Crown with median carina ( Fig. 7 ) ( Philippines : Mindanao).......................................
S. carinata Baker

- Crown without median carina ( Fig. 46 ) ( Philippines : Luzon)......................................
S. tagalica Baker

17. Pronotum with narrow dark brown stripe on either side of median carina in anterior half ( Fig. 6 ) ( Malaysia : Borneo)...............................................................................................
S. bilineata Baker

18. Aedeagus ventral process arms diverging posteriorly from base (
Takiya et al . 2013
: Fig. 32 )...
S. delicata Takiya & Dietrich
- Aedeagus ventral process arms not divergent from base ( Figs 111 , 149 ).......................................... 19

materialsCitation.keyLead:
19. Aaedeagus ventral process arms with inner margins straight ( Fig. 111 ) ( Malaysia : Sarawak )..........
S. dulitensis
sp. nov.

paragraph.keyLead:
- Aedeagus ventral process arms with inner margins straight in basal half and divergent in apical half ( Fig. 149 ) ( Malaysia : Quoin Hill).........................................................................
S. quoinensis
sp. nov.
